div.p: A security claim is some kind of information that may be provided about a Security Principal. These claims can be used to make access control decisions when the security principal performs some kind of operation. Claims may be made directly against principals, or made about groups to which the principal is assigned.
FHIR defines a number of security related resources:

tr.td: A record of an event made for purposes of maintaining a security log
Tracks a human or software device that uses the system
A group of rights for security principals
A definition of a claim that can be made about a user

div.p: Many specifications define claims that may be made in regard to security principals:

ul.li: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2009/09/identity/claims/...: A claim type defined by WS-I
http://openid.net/connect/[x]: A claim type defined in the OpenID Connect specification. [x] is the name of the claim, and the value will be an escaped JSON representation of the claim

div.p: In addition, this specification defines two claim types of it's own:

ul.li: http://hl7.org/fhir/tag/security: a reference to a security label - this means that the real world entity has the label applied to it
http://hl7.org/fhir/security-role: a reference to a security role defined by FHIR. See below for details.

div.p: Finally, implementation guides or implementing systems can define their own security claims using the SecurityClaim resource.
